name.text: Finding the Surface Area and Capacity of a Goblet

questiontext.text:
A goblet is made up of a hemisphere mounted on top of a cylindrical base. The hemisphere has a radius of \({@r@} \,\text{m}\), and the cylindrical base has the same radius with a height of \({@h@} \,\text{m}\).

Answer the following:

  1. Find the total external surface area of the goblet.

    \(\text{Surface area}=\)[[input:ans1]]\(\,\text{m}^2\)[[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

  2. Determine the maximum volume of liquid the goblet can hold.

    \(\text{Volume}=\)[[input:ans2]]\(\,\text{m}^3\)[[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked Solution

The goblet consists of two parts:

  • a cylindrical base
  • a hemisphere on top

From the question, the dimensions are:
Radius of the hemisphere and cylinder = {@r@} m
Height of the cylindrical base = {@h@} m

  1. Find the total external surface area of the goblet

    Step 1: Curved surface area of the cylinder
    \( \begin{align} \text{CSA of cylinder} &= 2 \pi r h \\ &= 2 \times \frac{22}{7} \times {@r@} \times {@h@} \\ &= {@CSA_cyl_val@} \,\text{m}^2 \end{align} \)

    Step 2: Curved surface area of the hemisphere
    \( \begin{align} \text{CSA of hemisphere} &= 2 \pi r^2 \\ &= 2 \times \frac{22}{7} \times ({@r@})^2 \\ &= {@CSA_hemi_val@} \,\text{m}^2 \end{align} \)

    Step 3: Total external surface area
    \( \begin{align} \text{Total surface area} &= {@CSA_cyl_val@} + {@CSA_hemi_val@} \\ &= {@Total_SA_val@} \,\text{m}^2 \end{align} \)

  2. Determine the maximum volume of liquid the goblet can hold

    Step 1: Volume of the cylinder
    \( \begin{align} V_{\text{cylinder}} &= \pi r^2 h \\ &= \frac{22}{7} \times ({@r@})^2 \times {@h@} \\ &= {@Vol_cyl@} \,\text{m}^3 \end{align} \)

    Step 2: Volume of the hemisphere
    \( \begin{align} V_{\text{hemisphere}} &= \frac{2}{3} \pi r^3 \\ &= \frac{2}{3} \times \frac{22}{7} \times ({@r@})^3 \\ &= {@Vol_hemi@} \,\text{m}^3 \end{align} \)

    Step 3: Total volume of goblet
    \( \begin{align} V_{\text{total}} &= {@Vol_cyl@} + {@Vol_hemi@} \\ &= {@Total_Vol_val@} \,\text{m}^3 \end{align} \)

questionnote.text:
\(\text{The radius of the Goblet}={@r@}\,\text{m}\)

\(\text{The height of the Goblet}={@h@}\,\text{m}\)

\(\text{The Surface area of the Goblet}={@Total_SA@}\,\text{m}^2\)

\(\text{The volume of the Goblet}={@Total_Vol_val@}\,\text{m}^3\)
